[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/messaging/v1/mod.rs] [Trait: IncomingRequest] [Generic type abuse] Since to_message() is generic over any DeserializeOwned type, can attackers cause the validator to attempt deserializing raw_request bytes into incorrect types, triggering panics or undefined behavior? [File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/messaging/v1/mod.rs] [Struct: DirectSendMsg] [Message integrity] DirectSendMsg lacks any integrity check (MAC/signature) - are messages vulnerable to tampering in transit, allowing man-in-the-middle attacks on consensus messages? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/messaging/v1/mod.rs] [Function: network_message_frame_codec()] [Zero max_frame_size] Can an attacker or misconfiguration set max_frame_size to 0, causing all messages to be rejected and halting all network communication? (High)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/messaging/v1/mod.rs] [Type: RequestId] [RequestId wraparound] When RequestId wraps around from u32::MAX to 0, can this cause collisions with active requests, leading to response mismatch and state corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/messaging/v1/mod.rs] [Struct: ErrorCode] [Recursive errors] Can sending an ErrorCode message that itself fails to deserialize cause infinite error loops, exhausting resources and causing validator crashes? (Medium)
